data.description: Are you a current student interested in data, analytics, and making a positive impact in the life insurance industry? Do you enjoy being part of a team that works with a diverse range of products and technologies? About the Business LexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Insurance vertical, we provide customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry-specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. Our insurance risk solutions help drive better data-driven decisions across the insurance policy lifecycle, all while reducing risk. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below. https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insurance About our Team Our Life Insurance Vertical provides strategy, market insights, and product development to help life insurance companies identify prospects, reduce risk, and enhance customer experiences. We are committed to making financial protection accessible to more people.About the Role Join our Life Insurance Vertical team, where we help life insurance companies improve their services and make financial protection more accessible for everyone. As a Life Insurance intern, you will work on meaningful projects that support our mission and strategic goals, especially in health intelligence. You’ll collaborate with team members from underwriting, analytics, and product management, contributing to real-world solutions.Location: On-site in Alpharetta, GA. Relocation assistance is not provided.Program Dates: May 18 – July 24, 2026Eligibility: Undergraduate students expected to graduate by May 2027Responsibilities Collaborate with team members across the Life Vertical, Analytics, and Product Management groups to support ongoing projects.Support projects that enhance our understanding of medical conditions by identifying and organizing key data points from publicly available resources.Develop recommendations for integrating various types of health data (e.g., diagnosis codes, procedures, lab results, social and prescription history) to improve our product offerings.Expand and update our competitive analysis of the life insurance market, including research on industry trends, social media presence, thought leadership, partnerships, and recent changes in leadership or hiring.Analyze and highlight standard and unique features of life insurance solutions, identifying areas of opportunity or potential risk for the business.Work closely with analytics experts and product managers to ensure findings are accurate, actionable, and contribute to real-world business decisions.Requirements Be a current student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, risk management, public health, marketing, math, statistics, or a related field with a graduation date of May 2027.Possess excellent analytical and communication skills.Demonstrate attention to detail and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Showcase openness to learning and contributing in a professional matrix environment.Display experience or interest in healthcare insurance, data analysis, or coding (e.g., ICD-10, SNOMED, Rx data) is welcome but is not required.Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work here.Salary$20/hour #earlycareer This position is not eligible for benefits. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form or please contact 1-855-833-5120.Criminals may pose as recruiters asking for money or personal information. We never request money or banking details from job applicants. Learn more about spotting and avoiding scams here.Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.We are an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.USA Job Seekers:EEO Know Your Rights.
